articles.title: What's the difference between moths and butterflies? Look at their antennae
articles.description: As the weather starts to warm in Australia, you might notice the pleasant flutter of butterflies in your garden during the day. And perhaps if you've left a porch light on during the night, you will see a flurry of moths have gathered around it.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: National living wage reduced labor mobility across jobs, study finds
articles.description: New research led by Bayes Business School has revealed the introduction of the National Living Wage (NLW) in the UK in April 2016 significantly decreased labor mobility across firms by minimum wage workers.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Orthopedic implants aim to last longer with liquid metal-based nanomaterials
articles.description: A pioneering liquid metal combination is shaping up as a potential secret weapon in the global fight against antimicrobial resistance, and promises to outlast existing implant materials.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Slime mold metabolites are a promising, eco-friendly repellent of root-knot nematodes
articles.description: Root-knot nematodes (RKNs) are worm-like parasites of the genus Meloidogyne that are found in many parts of the world. They attack the roots of plants, causing them to wilt and eventually die. It is estimated that crops worth nearly USD 173 billion are lost every year due to RKN infestations. While chemical pesticides are effective in controlling RKNs, they also kill other microorganisms that are beneficial to plants, thereby reducing soil fertility. New, less toxic control methods are needed to prevent the loss of crops and soil fertility to RKNs.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Kimberley Lane
articles.title: We saw Saturn and Jupiter with this telescope and now it's even cheaper for Prime Day
articles.description: Our optics writer bought the Celestron AstroMaster 130EQ last Prime Day, and it's discounted again this year — we think it's a great starter scope to view Saturn and Jupiter.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Male flies are not mini-females: Cell-specific, non-uniform growth drives sexual size differences in fruit flies
articles.description: Sexual size differences are widespread in biology, yet the "how" behind them often remains vague. We asked a concrete question in a classic model organism: when female flies are larger than males, do individual organs achieve this by adding more cells, enlarging the cells they already have, or mixing both strategies—and is this consistent across the body?
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Self-cleaving receptors act as cellular quality control for protein synthesis
articles.description: Researchers at Leipzig University and Martin Luther University Halle-Wittenberg have investigated a previously unknown process that occurs during protein synthesis in the cell. They examined how so-called adhesion G protein-coupled receptors (aGPCRs) split themselves into two parts.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Research shines light on 'double-yielding' behavior in soft materials
articles.description: For decades, scientists have observed, but been unable to explain, a phenomenon seen in some soft materials: When force is applied, these materials exhibit not one, but two spikes in energy dissipation, known as overshoots. Because overshoots are generally thought to indicate the point at which a material yields, or transitions from solid-like to fluid-like behavior, the dual response was therefore assumed to indicate "double yielding"—the idea that to fully fluidize a material, it needed to yield twice.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Global atlas of thermal tolerance provides heat check for freshwater organisms
articles.description: Climate change not only causes temperatures on land and in the sea to rise, but also leads to warming rivers, lakes, and streams—with serious consequences for the animals living within them. A research team at the University of Duisburg-Essen has published the largest openly accessible collection of data on the thermal tolerance of freshwater organisms to date. This data helps water management and government authorities to enact preventive measures to protect animals living in and around water.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Canal Istanbul stirs fear and uncertainty in nearby villages
articles.description: In Sazlibosna village, along the planned route of the vast Canal Istanbul project, 68-year-old Yasar Demirkaya fidgets with worn prayer beads as he sips tea at a cafe, uncertain about the future.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: From refugee to Nobel: Yaghi hails science's 'equalising force'
articles.description: Born into a family of Palestinian refugees in Jordan with little schooling, Nobel chemistry laureate Omar Yaghi on Wednesday paid tribute to science's "equalizing force".
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Researchers discover a hidden atomic order that persists in metals even after extreme processing
articles.description: For decades, it's been known that subtle chemical patterns exist in metal alloys, but researchers thought they were too minor to matter—or that they got erased during manufacturing. However, recent studies have shown that in laboratory settings, these patterns can change a metal's properties, including its mechanical strength, durability, heat capacity, radiation tolerance, and more.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Anna Gora
articles.title: Save 77% and get three months extra with this excellent NordVPN Prime Day deal
articles.description: With NordVPN's Prime Day plan, you can watch your favorite David Attenborough nature documentaries from anywhere in the world — and now, you can save up to $648 on its excellent 2-year plans.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Protein nanorings designed to detect and neutralize SARS-CoV2 virus
articles.description: An international team of scientists has generated a new ring-shaped protein nanomaterial capable of strongly binding to and neutralizing the SARS-CoV2 virus. The study, published in Advanced Healthcare Materials, highlights the versatility of the system devised to design the nanorings, which can integrate therapeutic and diagnostic capabilities, and be adapted to combat other viruses.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Tianwen-2 probe takes a selfie with Earth to mark China's National Day
articles.description: The China National Space Administration's (CNSA) Tianwen-2 probe is currently at a distance of about 43 million km (26.7 million mi) from Earth. This places it in a stable geosynchronous orbit (GSO) and almost halfway between its first destination, the near-Earth asteroid (NEA) 469219 Kamo'oalewa, which is still 45 million km (~28 million mi) away. As is customary for interplanetary missions, its controllers are using the flight phase to test the spacecraft's instruments and make sure they are in working order.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Four things to know about climate change and human migration
articles.description: Climate change is making some regions less habitable for humans, whether by raising sea levels, hurting crop yields, or intensifying droughts, storms, and wildfires. Yet, if you ask people why they're moving, few say it's for climate reasons, said Hélène Benveniste, an assistant professor of environmental social sciences at the Stanford Doerr School of Sustainability.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Veggie 'burgers' face the chop as EU lawmakers back labeling ban
articles.description: The European Parliament voted Wednesday to ban the use of meat-related terms including "burger" and "steak" to market plant-based foods, in a win for disgruntled farmers.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Illegal cannabis cultivation leaves lasting chemical footprint on California's public lands
articles.description: A study published in Science of the Total Environment sheds light on the persistent chemical contaminants left behind at illegal cannabis cultivation sites, also known as "trespass grows," on California's federally managed lands.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Deforestation can cause eight-fold increase in flood event risk
articles.description: New research, based on forest fires in Australia, proves there is a significantly higher risk of large-scale flooding when major deforestation has occurred in catchment areas. The chance of large-scale flooding in a specific catchment area can increase by as much as 700% if widespread deforestation has occurred.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Scientists just proved the moai could walk, solving a 500-year mystery
articles.description: Researchers confirmed that Rapa Nui’s moai statues could “walk” upright using a rocking motion, aided by rope and just a few people. Experiments with replicas and 3D models revealed design features like a forward lean and curved bases that made movement possible. Concave roads across the island further supported this transport method. The findings celebrate the innovation and intelligence of the ancient islanders.
articles.source: Sciencedaily

articles.title: Deadwood brings wild orchids to life: Study uncovers important carbon flux in the ecosystem
articles.description: Orchid seeds are as small as dust and do not provide any nutrients for the young plant to grow. The adult plants are known to rely on a certain type of fungi that develop structures within the plant's roots, but whether these same fungi also help with germination has not been established.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: The remarkable rise of eBird—the world's biggest citizen science project
articles.description: The lights in the auditorium darken. The cacophony of voices subsides. The enormous screen comes to life, displaying a satellite image of Australia and the scattering of islands directly to the north. The contrast between the dry, orangey red of most of Australia and the deep green of Papua New Guinea is stark.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Why Annabelle, Chucky and dolls in general creep us out
articles.description: Toy dolls are having a Halloween moment. And it's anything but pretty or cute.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Sarah Derouin
articles.title: How Might Leftover Corn Stalks Halt Fugitive Carbon?
articles.description: Bio-oil made from plant waste could help limit carbon emissions from orphaned oil and gas wells. But would it help or hinder farmers’ bottom line?
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.author: Sarah Stanley
articles.title: Magnetic “Switchback” Detected near Earth for First Time
articles.description: Until recently, this type of zigzag shape—formed by energetic rearrangement of magnetic field lines—had been seen only near the Sun.
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.title: AI-based method accurately segments and quantifies overlapping cell membranes
articles.description: Researchers at University of Tsukuba have developed DeMemSeg, an AI-powered analysis pipeline that addresses a long-standing challenge in microscopy: precisely segmenting and measuring individual cell membranes that overlap in two-dimensional (2D) projection images. This innovation is expected to accelerate research on cellular mechanisms and related diseases.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Every third school in Vilnius lies in a high air pollution zone, Lithuanian study reveals
articles.description: A study carried out by researchers at the Center for Physical Sciences and Technology (FTMC) revealed that 37% of primary and secondary schools in Vilnius, the capital of Lithuania, are exposed to harmful air pollutants due to their proximity to major high-traffic roads.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Protected areas in the Hauraki Gulf nearly triple under a new law—but it comes with a catch
articles.description: A new law that almost triples the protected area in the Hauraki Gulf Tīkapa Moana—New Zealand's largest marine park at more than 1.2 million hectares, surrounding Auckland and the Coromandel peninsula—is something to be celebrated.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Likely origins of black hole collision with 'squashed' orbital path revealed
articles.description: Scientists have begun to unravel the origin story of a cataclysmic collision between two black holes, which seem to have met their fate on a rarely observed "squashed" orbital path.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Whiskers for warrens: Why wombats have such whiskery snouts
articles.description: Wombat noses and whiskers don't just make them adorable. Both are unique sensory organs essential for navigation, foraging and communication. They're crucial to wombat survival in complex environments. The two different types of wombats are even named and classified according to their noses and whiskers.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Half the UK's fish stocks are overfished—but the evidence shows how they can be revived
articles.description: Most of the UK's commercial fish stocks are not in a healthy state, according to a new landmark report.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Soil bacteria and minerals can form a natural 'battery' that breaks down antibiotics in the dark
articles.description: Researchers have unveiled a surprising new way that soil microbes can use sunlight energy—even after the lights go out. A team from Kunming University of Science and Technology and the University of Massachusetts Amherst has developed a "bio-photovoltage soil-microbe battery" that can capture, store, and release solar energy to power the breakdown of antibiotic pollutants in the dark.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: New data analysis finds significant wage disparities for Latinas across California counties
articles.description: In some of California's wealthiest counties, Latinas tend to experience an extreme wage gap when compared to non-Hispanic white men, a new analysis from UCLA Chicano Studies Research Center and the Latina Futures 2050 Lab shows.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: V717 Andromedae is an active low mass ratio contact binary, observations reveal
articles.description: Astronomers from Australia and Serbia have performed multi-band photometric observations of a binary star known as V717 Andromedae. The observations yielded crucial information regarding the properties of V717 Andromedae, finding that it is an active low mass ratio contact binary system. The new findings are detailed in a research paper published Sept. 27 on the arXiv preprint server.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: cybernewswire
articles.title: Miggo Security Named a Gartner® Cool Vendor in AI Security
articles.description: Tel Aviv, Israel, 8th October 2025, CyberNewsWire
articles.source: Next Big Future

articles.title: Trio win Nobel chemistry prize for developing 'Hermione's handbag' materials
articles.description: Trio win Nobel chemistry prize for developing 'Hermione's handbag' materials
articles.source: Yahoo News

articles.author: Kimberley Lane
articles.title: Astro lovers' Prime Day pick: Canon favorite discounted ahead of the Supermoons and Orionids
articles.description: This $210 saving on the Canon EOS R8 camera arrives right on time for photographing the upcoming Supermoons and Orionid meteor shower — but we don't know how long it'll last.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: EPA reverses stance on coke oven rules that U.S. Steel called unachievable
articles.description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is allowing implementation of a 2024 hazardous air pollution rule that imposed new emission control and monitoring requirements on facilities like the U.S. Steel's Clairton Coke Works, a few months after seeking to delay and rework it.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Wild mushroom harvesters in Mid-Atlantic region collect fungi, build community
articles.description: Foragers have been harvesting wild mushrooms in what is now Pennsylvania and the rest of the U.S. Mid-Atlantic region for centuries, but the extent and specifics of the practice in the region had not been formally studied.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Algorithm reveals 'magic sizes' for assembling programmable icosahedral shells at minimal cost
articles.description: Over the past decade, experts in the field of nanotechnology and materials science have been trying to devise architectures composed of small structures that spontaneously arrange themselves following specific patterns. Some of these architectures are based on so-called icosahedral shells, structures with 20 different triangular phases that are symmetrically organized.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Larissa G. Capella
articles.title: Comb-like wings help the tiniest insects swim through ‘syrupy’ air
articles.description: When you're the size of a grain of sand, flying through air is like swimming through a syrup. Bristled wings help the tiniest insects manage this.
articles.source: Science News For Students

articles.title: Once dominant, US agricultural exports falter amid trade disputes and rising competition
articles.description: The U.S. has traditionally been an agricultural powerhouse with a healthy trade surplus. But global dynamics are changing due to a confluence of political and economic factors. U.S. agricultural imports now exceed exports, and the trade deficit is projected to worsen in the coming years.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Wildlife flee as floods swamp Indian parks
articles.description: A herd of elephants, along with tigers and leopards, have escaped after raging floods in India submerged two of West Bengal's famed wildlife sanctuaries, state officials said Wednesday.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Patrick Pester
articles.title: 'Harry Potter' materials land three scientists Nobel Prize in chemistry
articles.description: Researchers have won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal–organic frameworks."
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Chemistry Nobel awarded to three scientists for their work on metal organic frameworks
articles.description: The winners of the prestigious science prize was announced by the Nobel committee in Sweden.
articles.source: BBC News - Science & Environment

articles.title: Energy storage and new materials eyed for chemistry Nobel
articles.description: The development of new compounds and novel ways of storing energy are some of the research fields commentators say could be contenders for the Nobel Prize in Chemistry announced Wednesday.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Snakebite surge as Bangladesh hit by record rains
articles.description: In the swamplands along Bangladesh's mighty Padma River, snakes slithering through villages have become an unrelenting menace, leaving residents terrified and hospitals overwhelmed with bite victims.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Lizard genetics provide new perspective on evolution
articles.description: Some colorful lizards and a mathematical formula from the finance sector have been used to build a new framework to model evolution.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Dave Petley
articles.title: The 17 December 2024 Takhini River landslide and river-ice tsunami, Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada
articles.description: A major slope collapse in frozen sediments in Canada highlights the role of progressive failure. Back in January of this year, I posted fascinating a piece by Derek Cronmiller of the Yukon Geological Survey about the 17 December 2024 Takhini River landslide and river-ice tsunami, which occurred in Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada. The location of this […]
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.title: Imported cut flowers at low risk of spreading livestock viruses, finds study
articles.description: A study in Medical and Veterinary Entomology has investigated whether Culicoides biting midges—tiny insects that can carry serious livestock viruses—are being accidentally exported from Africa to Europe in shipments of cut flowers.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: The Editors
articles.title: Podcast: How to Cover Science Under Trump
articles.description: In the Season 2 finale, hosts Brooke Borel and Anna Rothschild talk to Tom Zeller Jr., Undark’s editor-in-chief, about covering science under the Trump administration. While the podcast’s topics are always politically charged, they have become even more so in the current political climate.
articles.source: Truth Beauty Science. - Undark

articles.title: INTEGRA Biosciences’ SWITCH hybrid pipette sets a new standard for ergonomic pipetting
articles.description: INTEGRA Biosciences' SWITCH hybrid pipette has been scientifically evaluated for ergonomics through an in-depth collaboration with the Zurich University of Applied Sciences (ZHAW). The SWITCH combines the tactile control of manual pipetting with the intelligent repeat dispense function of an electronic system, offering laboratories a new standard in comfort, precision and efficiency...
articles.source: Lab Bulletin

articles.title: Tree swallows thrive despite pollution from forever chemicals
articles.description: A new paper in Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry indicates high levels of exposure to "forever chemicals" in the environments of many tree swallow bird groups in the United States. Despite this, chemical exposure did not seem to affect the reproductive health of the birds.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Moffitt Cancer Center Partners with Leica Biosystems to Advance Digital Pathology Statewide
articles.description: Leica Biosystems, a global leader in anatomic and digital pathology solutions, and Moffitt Cancer Center, one of the nation’s top cancer hospitals and a leader in cancer research, are expanding their partnership to accelerate the adoption of digital pathology across the state. This strategic collaboration marks Florida’s first large-scale implementation of digital pathology technology, aimed at improving speed, precision and access to pathology services...
articles.source: Lab Bulletin

articles.author: Delthia Ricks
articles.title: John B. Gurdon, 92, Dies; Nobelist Paved Way for Cloning of Animals
articles.description: His work in the manipulation of cells laid the foundation for stem cell biology and regenerative medicine and led to the first cloned large mammal, a sheep named Dolly.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.author: Kenneth Chang
articles.title: Mars Orbiter Captures Rare Images of Interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS
articles.description: 3I/ATLAS, only the third object from beyond our solar system ever spotted from Earth, was viewed from Mars by an orbiting European spacecraft.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.title: Assessing overconfidence among national security officials
articles.description: National security officials are "overwhelmingly overconfident," which hinders their ability to accurately assess uncertainty, according to new research by a Dartmouth government professor. When they thought statements had a 90% chance of being true, the statements were only true about 60% of the time, according to the study.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Scientists unlock new patterns of protein behavior in cell membranes
articles.description: Cellular membrane proteins play many important roles throughout the body, including transporting substances in and out of the cell, transmitting signals, speeding up reactions and helping neighboring cells stick together. When they malfunction, it can cause serious diseases including cancer, making them attractive drug targets. But understanding how membrane proteins behave and function can be challenging because their position within the cell's lipid membrane—a tightly-packed double layer of fat-like molecules—makes them difficult to study.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Adding human guidance to AI tutors enhances benefits for students, study finds
articles.description: Human tutoring and computer-based AI tutors are widely recognized for their effectiveness in supporting learning. However, human tutoring is expensive and difficult to scale, and AI tutors vary widely in their ability to adapt to students' academic and motivational needs. In a new study, a team of researchers has evaluated a year-long virtual human-AI tutoring program during classroom use of AI tutors. Students tutored in the program outperformed students tutored by AI alone.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Bacterial enzyme and nanoparticle discoveries hold promise for treating gut pain
articles.description: Abdominal pain is a hallmark of many digestive disorders, including inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome. In an effort to develop targeted treatments for gut pain, scientists have discovered a new enzyme in gut bacteria and are using nanoparticles to deliver drugs inside cells.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: High-speed onion mist: Cutting technique and blade sharpness affect droplet spray, study shows
articles.description: A new discovery about how cutting onions ejects pungent aerosols up to two-thirds of a meter into the air has led to practical advice for reducing the spray: Cut onions slowly with a sharpened blade or coat an onion in oil before cutting.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Tom Metcalfe
articles.title: Hundreds of ancient gold and silver coins from possible Celtic market found in Czech Republic
articles.description: Hundreds of gold and silver coins, along with jewelry and other artifacts, have been found in the Czech Republic at what might have been an ancient Celtic market.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Antarctic Circumpolar Current flowed three times faster 130,000 years ago, core samples reveal
articles.description: The Antarctic Circumpolar Current (ACC) is Earth's largest oceanic current, circling around Antarctica from west to east in alignment with Earth's rotation. This cold ocean current is driven primarily by the westerly wind drift. Connecting the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian Oceans, the ACC is critical for global heat transport, the carbon cycle and the interoceanic exchanging of nutrients. The ACC thus influences the regional and the global climate, and impacts biodiversity.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Europe isn't prepared for the unmanned aircraft threat. Will its 'drone wall' be enough?
articles.description: As Moscow's military offensive grinds on at Europe's eastern edge, tensions are skyrocketing on the continent due to repeated, brazen violations of European airspace deliberately orchestrated by Russia. Europe has announced counter-measures, in the form of a "drone wall" to combat this new threat.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: How land restoration could address malnutrition among India's Indigenous families
articles.description: When asked how she was doing during her second pregnancy, Neethu, 24, told us she felt worried and cautious.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Eight out of 10 supply chain risk categories show decline for 4th quarter
articles.description: The results of the Lehigh Business Supply Chain Risk Management Index for the 4th quarter of 2025 indicate a decrease in risk, with eight out of ten risk categories showing a decline. Cybersecurity and Data Risk sits at the top of the list with a modest rise.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: US Latinos hit new population and labor force records
articles.description: For the first time in history, one out of every five people in the U.S. is Latino, according to a new data analysis by the Latino GDP Project from UCLA and Cal Lutheran. Using 2024 data from the U.S. Census Bureau, which was released in June, researchers discovered an increase of 2 million persons in this demographic compared to the updated 2023 population estimates. The total U.S. Latino population is estimated to be more than 68 million, they found.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Why free speech rights got left out of the Constitution—and added in later via the First Amendment
articles.description: Bipartisan agreement is rare in these politically polarized days.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Policing in a pandemic: Harlem residents speak out on safety, bias and mistrust
articles.description: A new study examines how social and geographic factors shaped community perceptions toward the police amid a backdrop of public health crisis and social unrest. The study is published in PLOS One, and was led by Center for Innovation in Mental Health (CIMH) researchers Professor Victoria Khanh Ngo and Dr. Thinh Toan Vu, in collaboration with Harlem Health Initiative Director Deborah Levine, Distinguished Professor Luisa N. Borrell, Professor Pedro Mateu-Gelabert, and colleagues.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Splitting water: How order and disorder direct chemical reactivity
articles.description: In nature, the behavior of systems—whether large or small—is always governed by a few fundamental principles. For instance, objects fall downward because it minimizes their energy. At the same time, order and disorder are key variables that also shape physical processes. Systems—especially our homes—tend to become increasingly disordered over time. Even at the microscopic level, systems tend to favor increased disorder, a phenomenon known as an increase in so-called entropy.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Leafcutter ants have blind spots, just like truck drivers
articles.description: We have all been in that situation: The moving boxes are large and heavy, but we are determined to carry them all in one trip, even if that means we can't see where we're going. In the tropics, some leafcutter ants face a similar challenge: carrying a load that is several times their body weight. To make matters even more difficult, carrying oversized weights may create "blind spots" when leafcutter ants transport material on a trail.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Eco-friendly technology removes toxic PFAS from water
articles.description: Rice University researchers, in collaboration with international partners, have developed the first eco-friendly technology to rapidly capture and destroy toxic "forever chemicals" (PFAS) in water. The findings, recently published in Advanced Materials, mark a major step toward addressing one of the world's most persistent environmental threats.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.title: Tesla FSD 14.1 Gamechangning Parking Solutions
articles.description: Elite Tesla FSD tester Chuck cook says FSD 14.1 is ready and safe enough for wide release and has gamechanging ability to start from park and end the drive in a specific parking mode for basically a taxi cab like experience. Sawyer Merritt says FSD V14 is blowing his mind right now. For the first ... Read more
articles.source: Next Big Future

articles.title: Bamboo-based plastic can be made to biodegrade quickly, but still holds up in tough conditions
articles.description: A new method to produce strong, biodegradable plastic from bamboo is reported in Nature Communications this week. The bioplastic resembles oil-based plastics in strength, shapability, and thermal stability but can biodegrade in soil within 50 days, presenting a new pathway toward sustainable plastic alternatives.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Anna Gora
articles.title: Our favorite noise-canceling headphones are now a huge $150 off in the Prime Day sale
articles.description: Save 43% on the ultra-cosy Bose QuietComfort headphones at Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Abandoned land drives dangerous heat in Houston, researchers find
articles.description: On a scorching Texas afternoon, some Houston neighborhoods heat up far faster than others. New research from Texas A&M University shows vacant and abandoned land is a big reason why.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Internet favors the development of flexible identities among language learners
articles.description: A review reveals that the interplay between technology, identity, and languages involves and encourages multiple identities, language mixing, and support for minority languages.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Considering the risk of wildlife-spread diseases during ecosystem restoration
articles.description: Ecosystem restoration projects aim to restore biodiversity and associated compromised ecosystem services. Evidence is persuasive of the increased risks of zoonotic diseases with degradation and disturbances. However, the scientific literature on the mitigating effects of ecosystem restoration on zoonotic spillover is scattered, inconclusive and challenged by the lack of a conceptual framework and practical guidance.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: AI adoption jumps to 84% among researchers as expectations undergo significant 'reality check'
articles.description: Wiley today announced key findings from its second ExplanAItions study, revealing a major course correction taking place.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Tory plan to scrap net zero target puts UK climate leadership at risk
articles.description: In the mid-2000s, soon after becoming Conservative leader, David Cameron hugged a husky on a trip to the Arctic, in what was widely described as an attempt to "detoxify" the Tory brand. Eighteen years later, Kemi Badenoch has promised to scrap the law that once made that rebranding credible.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Smartphones manipulate our emotions and trigger our reflexes. No wonder we're addicted
articles.description: The frequency and length of daily phone use continues to rise, especially among young people. It's a global concern, driving recent decisions to ban phones in schools in Canada, the United States and elsewhere.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Observing quantum weirdness in our world: Nobel physics explained
articles.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to three scientists on Tuesday for discovering that a bizarre barrier-defying phenomenon in the quantum realm could be observed on an electrical circuit in our classical world.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Chinese companies are changing the way they operate in Africa: Here's how
articles.description: For most of the past 25 years, Chinese construction companies operating in Africa could count on generous financial backing from Chinese banks. Between 2000 and 2019, Chinese funders committed almost US$50 billion to African transport projects. Most came from Chinese development finance institutions.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Worrying levels of lead detected in the Indigenous population of the Amazon
articles.description: Researchers from the UAB and the UB are working with Indigenous Amazonian communities to understand health issues from a holistic perspective, including people, wildlife and the ecosystem.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: How fish affect carbon storage in the ocean
articles.description: Carbon is the chemical element found in the greenhouse gas CO₂ emitted from fossil fuels burned in cars, factories and other sources. When carbon is stored in the ocean instead of remaining in the atmosphere, it helps to reduce climate change on land.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Children are capable of extreme bravery from a young age. A psychologist explains how
articles.description: Developmental research often tells us how egocentric children are. Yet all too often we hear of children who are forced to demonstrate great courage and care in a crisis.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Africa's 'great green wall' is stalling: In Senegal very few planted areas show progress
articles.description: Africa's Great Green Wall project began as an ambitious plan to build a 15-kilometer-wide band of trees across the north of Africa. The African Union launched the project in 2007 with plans for the trees to extend for 6,000 kilometers through 11 countries in the Sahel, restoring 100 million hectares of land from Senegal to Djibouti and Ethiopia. Its main aim was to prevent the Sahara Desert from advancing. But the Great Green Wall's also been billed as a solution to climate change, poverty, and even extremism.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: From the pulpit to the picket line: For many miners, religion and labor rights have long been connected in coal country
articles.description: In October 2025, Cecil Roberts will officially retire from his role as president of the United Mine Workers of America. A sixth-generation coal miner, he has led the union for 30 years. Only one man held the role longer: John L. Lewis, whom many consider one of the most important labor leaders of the 20th century.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Researchers discover enlarged areas of the spinal cord in fish, previously found only in four-limbed vertebrates
articles.description: Four-limbed vertebrates, known as tetrapods, have two enlarged areas in their spinal cords. The two enlargements have a correlation with the forelimbs and hind limbs, respectively. These enlargements are thought to be caused by the complex muscular system and the rich sensory networks supplying nerves to the limbs.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Physicists detect water's ultraviolet fingerprint in interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS
articles.description: For millions of years, a fragment of ice and dust drifted between the stars—like a sealed bottle cast into the cosmic ocean. This summer, that bottle finally washed ashore in our solar system and was designated 3I/ATLAS, only the third known interstellar comet. When Auburn University scientists pointed NASA's Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory toward it, they made a remarkable find: the first detection of hydroxyl (OH) gas from this object, a chemical fingerprint of water.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Tina Hesman Saey
articles.title: Finding cells that stop our body from attacking itself lands a Nobel
articles.description: Shimon Sakaguchi won for discovering T-reg immune cells. Mary Brunkow and Fred Ramsdell won for showing the cells’ role in autoimmune disease.
articles.source: Science News For Students

articles.title: Between rain and snow, machine learning finds nine precipitation types
articles.description: In research that could improve weather forecasting and winter driving safety, a University of Michigan-led study distinguished nine distinct precipitation types—varieties of rain, snow and mixed-phase (e.g., sleet)—using unsupervised machine learning and nearly a decade's worth of high-speed camera data. The research is published in Science Advances.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: The H-1B visa fee hike in the United States opens a policy window for Canada
articles.description: The United States government recently announced a US$100,000 H-1B visa fee on new applications, which will affect highly educated workers from abroad who are seeking jobs in the U.S. This policy could have ripple effects for Canada by reducing the emigration of Canadians going to work in the U.S.—and by attracting a talented workforce to the country.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Tariffs have potential to reshape US beer market, says study
articles.description: The ripple effects of increased tariffs under President Trump could extend to the $117 billion U.S. beer market, according to new research from a University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign agricultural economist who studies food supply chains.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Wings, booze and heartbreak: What my research says about the hidden costs of sports fandom
articles.description: Being from Buffalo means getting to eat some of the best wings in the world. It means scraping snow and ice off your car in frigid mornings. And it means making a lifelong vow to the city's NFL franchise, the Bills—for better or worse, till death do us part.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Words matter when it comes to wages, prestige linked to female-associated jobs
articles.description: A new sociological study evaluated more than 127 billion words found in publications over a nearly 120-year period to shine a light on the various cultural reasons why society often devalues occupations typically held by women. The study "The Cultural Devaluation of Feminized Work: The Evolution of U.S. Occupational Prestige and Gender Typing in Linguistic Representations, 1900 to 2019" by Wenhao Jiang (Duke University) is published in the American Sociological Review.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: More young adults are living with their parents than previous generations did
articles.description: A potentially worrisome trend is emerging among young adults. Instead of landing a job and moving to the big city after graduation, many are moving back into their childhood homes instead. About 1.5 million more adults under 35 live with their parents today than a decade ago. That's a 6.3% jump, more than double the rate of growth for the young adult population overall.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Lucy Inglis
articles.title: 'The papyrus also recommends putting a clove of garlic in your vagina before bed': The texts that reveal the baffling healthcare for women in ancient Egypt
articles.description: In this excerpt from "Born: A History of Childbirth," author and historian Lucy Inglis reveals records from ancient Egypt that show how female physicians treated issues of "the womb," how men reacted to periods, and how the first known pregnancy test actually worked.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Two-step excitation unlocks and steers exotic nanolight
articles.description: An international team of researchers has developed a novel technique to efficiently excite and control highly-confined light-matter waves, known as higher-order hyperbolic phonon polaritons. Their method not only sets new records for the quality and propagation distance of these waves but also uses a sharp boundary to create a form of pseudo-birefringence, sorting and steering the waves by mode into different directions.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Kimberley Lane
articles.title: 5 of the best Prime Day stargazing deals we'd be buying this October
articles.description: We've tested dozens of telescopes, binoculars, cameras and star projectors, and here are five of the best Prime Day deals on products we've personally tested.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Easter Island's statues actually 'walked,' and physics backs it up
articles.description: For years, researchers have puzzled over how the ancient people of Rapa Nui did the seemingly impossible and moved their iconic moai statues. Using a combination of physics, 3D modeling and on-the-ground experiments, a team including faculty at Binghamton University, State University of New York, has confirmed that the statues actually walked—with a little rope and remarkably few people.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Hidden highways of the sky mapped: How wind, temperature and species dynamics shape aerial habitat distribution
articles.description: High above us, the atmosphere is teeming with life. Birds, bats and insects share the airspace, but divide it into different lanes of traffic. New research from Lund University in Sweden reveals how the atmosphere is an ecosystem, with complex ecological processes that affect how animals move between different altitude levels.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Polymer scaffold can self-assemble in tissue to deliver multiple vaccine components over time
articles.description: Sometimes, the best way to achieve a big outcome is to start small. That principle is at the center of new work from a University of Virginia researcher who specializes in nanotechnology and controlled delivery of medical treatments.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Animations of wildlife tracking data help explore animal movements
articles.description: Researchers have developed new software for exploring and communicating animal movements in the wild.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Scientists learn that rare bacterium 'plays dead' to survive
articles.description: A rare microorganism found in an unexpected environment may be evading detection by "playing dead," according to microbiologists at the University of Houston.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Developing technology to deploy stabilized solar arrays and enable spacecraft docking
articles.description: Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) has developed technology to stiffen deployable structures on spacecraft, enabling autonomous spacecraft docking operations. SwRI is currently integrating the Parallelogram Synchronized Truss Assembly (PaSTA) technology with solar arrays on the Astroscale U.S. Refueler spacecraft. The team is also designing two different deployable booms using PaSTA technology for another spacecraft SwRI is developing.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Efficient bacterial modeling cuts computational costs for researchers
articles.description: Newcastle scientists have developed an efficient new model to track bacterial responses to toxic chemicals and nutrients.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Boosting work engagement through a simple smartphone diary
articles.description: Work engagement is a positive and persistent state of mind related to one's work. It is characterized by high energy and mental resilience (vigor), enthusiasm and involvement (dedication), and complete concentration in the task at hand (absorption). Engaged workers are not merely more productive; they are more likely to be proactive, creative, and less susceptible to burnout. Most importantly, work engagement has been consistently linked to many health benefits and overall well-being.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Hiring in high-growth firms: Exploring the timing of organizational changes
articles.description: High-growth firms (HGFs) refer to businesses that achieve rapid growth in terms of employees or revenue. Based on the established definition, HGFs are businesses with at least 10 employees and annual growth rates of 20% or more, observed over a period of three years. This three-year span is considered the high-growth (HG) period of the company. Even though this growth is often short-lived and difficult to sustain, it plays a significant role in driving economic dynamism. Hence, entrepreneurship-related research often focuses on the growth pattern of the HGFs and factors that affect their growth...
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Chemists discover new way of breaking down climate-damaging 'laughing gas'
articles.description: "Defying climate change calls for new approaches in breaking down greenhouse gases," Professor Jan Paradies of Paderborn University said. The chemist and his team have now moved a step closer to this goal: The scientists have successfully managed to reduce ozone-damaging nitrous oxide ("laughing gas") to its harmless constituent parts using metal-free catalysis at low temperatures. The results are published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Enzyme pair unlocks a microbial puzzle to better treat, prevent and detect disease
articles.description: Many medications and other therapeutic agents, including antibiotics and cancer therapies, must enter cells to reach their targets to have their effect. But that can pose a challenge, as drugs often have difficulty crossing the cell's protective membranes, get broken down before they reach their target, or do not reach the right cells.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Uncovering diverse water adsorption characteristics in metal–organic frameworks
articles.description: To combat water scarcity, producing water from unconventional sources is strategically important. One promising approach is atmospheric water harvesting, a technology proposed in recent years to extract water directly from the air using an emerging class of porous materials—metal–organic frameworks (MOFs).
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Increase in cell volume and nuclear number of the koji fungus enhances enzyme production capacity
articles.description: Researchers at University of Tsukuba have identified key characteristics underlying the high enzyme production capacity of the koji fungus Aspergillus oryzae.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Plant-based lubricant outperforms talc and microplastics, offering a nontoxic alternative for seed dispersal
articles.description: Researchers have developed a new class of nontoxic, biodegradable solid lubricants that can be used to facilitate seed dispersal using modern farming equipment, with the goal of replacing existing lubricants that pose human and environmental toxicity concerns. The paper, "Graph Theory Based Bioderived Solid Lubricant," is published in the journal Matter.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: First device based on 'optical thermodynamics' can route light without switches
articles.description: A team of researchers at the Ming Hsieh Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering has created a new breakthrough in photonics: the design of the first optical device that follows the emerging framework of optical thermodynamics.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: John Yoon
articles.title: Winning a Nobel Prize Interrupted His Off-the-Grid Vacation
articles.description: Fred Ramsdell found out about his Nobel Prize nearly 12 hours after it was announced because he was on vacation in the Rockies.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.title: Physicists develop new quantum sensor at the atomic lattice scale
articles.description: From computer chips to quantum dots—technological platforms were only made possible thanks to a detailed understanding of the used solid-state materials, such as silicon or more complex semiconductor materials. This understanding also includes being able to identify and control irregularities in the crystal lattice of such materials.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Yeast proteins reveal the secrets of drought resistance
articles.description: The human body is made up mostly of water. If this water is removed, the body's cells cannot survive, even when water is reintroduced. But some organisms can completely dry out yet return to life when rehydrated.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: cybernewswire
articles.title: INE Security Releases Industry Benchmark Report: “Wired Together: The Case for Cross-Training in Networking and Cybersecurity”
articles.description: Raleigh, United States, 7th October 2025, CyberNewsWire
articles.source: Next Big Future

articles.title: Plasma rampdown prediction model could improve reliability of fusion power plants
articles.description: Tokamaks are machines that are meant to hold and harness the power of the sun. These fusion machines use powerful magnets to contain a plasma hotter than the sun's core and push the plasma's atoms to fuse and release energy. If tokamaks can operate safely and efficiently, the machines could one day provide clean and limitless fusion energy.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: High-precision measurements reveal the energies of nuclear decays
articles.description: Neutrinos are very common fundamental particles included in the Standard Model of particle physics. Measuring their properties allows for creating more accurate models of the birth of the universe, the life of stars and the interactions between fundamental particles. Some of the open questions include the absolute mass of the neutrino and whether neutrinos are their own antiparticles.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Gravitational lenses imaged by Webb during its first run
articles.description: Periodically, the European Space Agency (ESA) releases images that provide breathtaking views of the cosmos, courtesy of its premier missions. This includes a relative newcomer to party with the ESA/Webb Picture of the Month, which showcases the high-resolution and ultra-sensitive capabilities of the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST). This month's feature: eight stunning images of gravitationally-lensed galaxies observed by Webb during its Cycle 1 General Observation (GO) surveys. The study of these lensed galaxies is providing insight into the early universe and how galaxies have evolved with...
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: The space beyond our planet is a long way from empty and a long way from boring
articles.description: We all need some space sometimes—but it's harder to find than you might think. How far into our universe do we have to go to reach somewhere truly empty?
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Climate change may create 'ecological trap' for species who can't adapt
articles.description: Even as autumn days grow shorter, a warming climate means Ohio winters aren't as cold as they were just a few decades ago, according to National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration data. This increasing mismatch between hours of daylight and temperature could spell trouble for animals that thrive by relying on seasonal cues to prepare their bodies for winter, according to new research from Case Western Reserve University.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Rebecca Robbins
articles.title: Taking Too Much Tylenol Has Proven Risks. Trump Didn’t Talk About Those.
articles.description: Acetaminophen’s link to autism is unproven. But hundreds of Americans accidentally overdose on the drug each year, suffering liver damage that can require a transplant or even be fatal.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.title: General relativity could make life possible on planets orbiting white dwarfs
articles.description: In the hunt for extraterrestrial life, we usually look for planets orbiting sun-like stars and icy moons. But there is another possible candidate—planets circling white dwarfs, the hot, dense remnants of dead stars.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Composite metal foam endures over 1 million load cycles at 400°C and 600°C
articles.description: New research shows that composite metal foam (CMF) is incredibly resilient at high temperatures, able to withstand repeated heavy loads even at temperatures of 400°C and 600°C. Coupled with the material's high strength-to-weight ratio, the finding suggests that CMF could be used in applications ranging from automobile engines to aerospace components to nuclear power technologies.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Powerful and precise multi-color lasers now fit on a single chip
articles.description: A few years ago, researchers in Michal Lipson's lab noticed something remarkable. They were working on a project to improve LiDAR, a technology that uses lightwaves to measure distance. The lab was designing high-power chips that could produce brighter beams of light.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Anjana K. Shah, Daniel H. Doctor, Chloe Gustafson and Alan D. Pitts
articles.title: New Maps of Natural Radioactivity Reveal Critical Minerals and More
articles.description: High-resolution airborne radiometric surveys are covering more ground than ever to provide insights into unseen geology, mineral resource potential, and possible health hazards.
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.author: Kimberly M. S. Cartier
articles.title: Ice Diatoms Glide at Record-Low Temperatures
articles.description: New observations reveal how microscopic organisms move through polar ice and illustrate how they may have evolved to thrive in extreme environments.
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.title: The future of Antarctic ice: New study reveals the mathematics of meltwater lakes
articles.description: Georgia Tech researchers have developed a mathematical formula to predict the size of lakes that form on melting ice sheets—discovering their depth and span are linked to the topography of the ice sheet itself.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Ancient teeth provide new insight into the lives of the world's first farming villagers
articles.description: Archaeologists have revealed new insights into how the world's first farming villagers formed communities, moved across the land and responded to outsiders.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: 'Bigfoot' virus found: New phage targets Legionnaires' disease-causing bacteria
articles.description: University of Toronto researchers have made the first discovery of a virus that infects Legionella pneumophila, the bacteria that causes Legionnaires' disease.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Some carbon projects are actually harmful to climate: Study shows how to avoid that
articles.description: An analysis of forest-based projects funded through the sale of carbon credits shows that 10% of them may have a net warming effect on the climate because of the way they alter Earth's albedo, or how much sunlight is reflected back into space.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Scientists discover hidden gecko species in Atacama desert
articles.description: Beneath the relentless sun of Chile's Atacama Desert, tiny geckos hide a remarkable secret. New genomic research, led by the University of Wollongong's (UOW) Kamryn Carter, has discovered that these resilient reptiles, known as Garthia geckos or Chilean marked geckos, comprise up to 11 distinct species, not the single species scientists previously thought.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: What parents need to know about AI in the classroom
articles.description: From immersive learning to personalized tutors, AI is everywhere in K-12 education. Here are three steps parents can take to stay informed and engaged.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Kimberley Lane
articles.title: Amazon just dropped the price on one of our favorite star projectors for Prime Day in October
articles.description: The Pococo Galaxy Star projector is now down to just $79.99 for Prime Day.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.author: Stephanie Pappas
articles.title: The Red Sea experienced 'one of the most extreme environmental events on Earth' 6 million years ago
articles.description: The Red Sea became a desert about 6.2 million years ago, before a massive flood from the Indian Ocean turned it into a waterway again.
articles.source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles

articles.title: Australian teachers are some of the highest users of AI in classrooms around the world, survey reveals
articles.description: Australian teachers are more likely to be using artificial intelligence than their counterparts around the world, according to a new international survey.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Setting health standards for sharks
articles.description: If you want to keep a shark healthy, you must first define what healthy is.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Nobel Prize for physics goes to 3 scientists for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
articles.description: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis won the Nobel Prize in Physics on Tuesday for research into quantum mechanical tunneling.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Emily Anthes
articles.title: How to Protect Your Pets From Pollution
articles.description: Wildfire smoke, lead paint and other environmental toxins are health hazards for animals, too.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.author: Pam Belluck and M. Scott Brauer
articles.title: He Was Expected to Get Alzheimer’s 25 Years Ago. Why Hasn’t He?
articles.description: Scientists are searching for the secret in Doug Whitney’s biology that has protected him from dementia, hoping it could lead to ways to treat or prevent Alzheimer’s for many other people.
articles.source: The New York Times

articles.title: The Nobel Prize in physics is to be announced Tuesday
articles.description: Nobel Prize in Physics will be announced Tuesday, the second award to be revealed this year by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm a day after a trio of scientists won the prize for contributions to medicine.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Florida's Mote Marine Laboratory relocates hundreds of marine animals to new $130M facility
articles.description: Crews used large nets, water-filled containers and box trucks to relocate hundreds of river otters, sea turtles, manatees, penguins and sharks to their new home: Mote Marine Laboratory & Aquarium.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Involuntary childlessness rates compared between Israel and US in international study
articles.description: Every Rosh Hashanah, annual reports are released focused on birth rates, the average number of children per family, and other population growth data. However, there's another side to these statistics: experiences of involuntary childlessness, in which people who wish to be parents are unable to for medical, social, or institutional reasons.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Industry scientists reveal reluctance to test chemicals for behavioral effects, despite growing evidence
articles.description: An international study led by the University of Portsmouth has revealed reluctance from industry scientists to test chemicals for their effects on human and wildlife behavior, despite growing evidence linking environmental pollutants to neurological disorders and behavioral changes.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.author: Molly Taft
articles.title: As EPA Ends Emissions Data Collection, Climate Groups May Step Up
articles.description: Last month, the agency announced it would no longer collect emissions data from polluting companies, data which is the backbone of U.S. air quality reporting systems and climate policy. Now, attention is turning to whether climate NGOs have the tools — and legal right — to fill the gap.
articles.source: Truth Beauty Science. - Undark

articles.author: Dave Petley
articles.title: Fatal landslides in July 2025
articles.description: In July 2025, I recorded 71 fatal landslides worldwide, with the loss of 214 lives. Each year, July is one of the key months for the occurrence of fatal landslides globally as the Asian monsoon season cranks up to full strength. Thus, it is time to provide an update on fatal landslides that occurred in […]
articles.source: Eos: Earth And Space Science News

articles.title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Launches Industry’s Most Complete, Enterprise- and Compliance-Ready Chromatography & Mass Spectrometry Data System with Chromeleon 7.4 Software
articles.description: Thermo Fisher Scientific has introduced Chromeleon 7.4 software, the first enterprise-ready, compliance-focused mass spectrometry (MS) and chromatography data system that covers single quad, triple quad and high-resolution accurate mass (HRAM) analysis. Chromeleon 7.4 software brings the company’s trusted technology platform to regulated and non-regulated laboratory environments, streamlining data management and expanding functionality for targeted quantitative MS workflows...
articles.source: Lab Bulletin
